query.prompt:

query.result: 10 I do not know who you are nor by what way 11 you have come down here; but Florentine 12 you seem to me truly when I hear you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Tu dei saper ch’i’ fui conte Ugolino, 14 e questi è l’arcivescovo Ruggieri: 15 or ti dirò perché i son tal vicino.
query.result: 13 You know that I was Count Ugolino, 14 and this is the archbishop Ruggieri: 15 now I will tell you why I am such a neighbor.

16 That because of the effect of his ever thoughts, 17 trusting in him, I was taken 18 and afterwards dead, to say is not a trade;
19 however that which you cannot have understood, 20 that is, how my death was cruel, 21 you will hear, and you will know if he has offended me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
151 Ahi Genovesi, uomini diversi 152 d’ogne costume e pien d’ogne magagna, 153 perché non siete voi del mondo spersi?
154 Ché col peggiore spirto di Romagna 155 trovai di voi un tal, che per sua opra 156 in anima in Cocito già si bagna,
157 e in corpo par vivo ancor di sopra.
query.result:
151 Ah Genoese, men different 152 of every costume and full of every blemish, 153 why are you not of the world lost?
154 Because with the worst spirit of Romagna 155 I found of you such a one, that by his work 156 in soul in Cocito already wets,
157 and in body seems alive still above.
